critique: The document is an executive order from 1943 during World War II, focused on managing manpower within the Executive branch of the Federal Government concerning selective service deferments. It aims to conserve manpower and efficiently utilize employees by systematizing occupational deferments. The order establishes committees to review and approve deferment requests, designates key positions essential to the war effort, and sets limitations on deferment requests. It also addresses voluntary entrance into the armed forces and dependency-occupational reclassification. The document centralizes control over deferments, prioritizing the war effort and national security.
